title: 342-Mile Shelby Cobra CSX1000
description: This Shelby is one of approximately 25 Cobra CSX1000 continuation cars completed with hand-formed aluminum bodywork out of England. This chassis features number CSX1018, which was purchased new by the current owner in February 2011 from Shelby Automobiles, Inc. The car is finished in white with blue over-the-top stripes over black leather upholstery, and power comes from a 427ci V8 paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes disc brakes, 15″ Halibrand-style knock-off wheels, side-mounted exhaust pipes, quick-jack bumperettes, a single roll hoop, a hood scoop, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and latch-and-link lap belts. A FuelSafe fuel cell was installed in 2024, and a clutch adjustment was performed in April 2025. This CSX1000 Cobra has 342 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a Manufacturer's Statement of Origin, a spare glovebox door with a Carroll Shelby signature, service records, and a clean California title in the name of the seller's trust, listing the car as a special construction vehicle with no model year.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 342-Mile Shelby Cobra CSX1000 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #189,594.
text: This Shelby is one of approximately 25 Cobra CSX1000 continuation cars completed with hand-formed aluminum bodywork out of England. This chassis features number CSX1018, which was purchased new by the current owner in February 2011 from Shelby Automobiles, Inc. The car is finished in white with blue over-the-top stripes over black leather upholstery, and power comes from a 427ci V8 paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes disc brakes, 15″ Halibrand-style knock-off wheels, side-mounted exhaust pipes, quick-jack bumperettes, a single roll hoop, a hood scoop, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and latch-and-link lap belts. A FuelSafe fuel cell was installed in 2024, and a clutch adjustment was performed in April 2025. This CSX1000 Cobra has 342 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a Manufacturer’s Statement of Origin, a spare glovebox door with a Carroll Shelby signature, service records, and a clean California title in the name of the seller’s trust, listing the car as a special construction vehicle with no model year. The CSX1000 series was introduced in the mid-2000s after Carroll Shelby reached an agreement with AC Cars to collaborate on a production run of aluminum-bodied continuation Cobras. After that partnership dissolved, the production of bodies for CSX1000 cars was shifted elsewhere in the UK. This example is finished in white with blue over-the-top stripes and features quick-jack bumperettes, a hood scoop, vented front fenders, plexiglass wind wings, coated side-exit exhaust pipes, a single roll hoop, and a flip-up fuel filler cap. Halibrand-style 15″ wheels with gray centers and polished lips are secured with three-eared knock-off spinners and are mounted with Goodyear Eagle Sport Car Special tires that measure 26.5×8″ up front and 26.5×10.5″ out back. The car is equipped with independent suspension, and stopping power is provided by discs at all four corners. The rear inner wheel wells were modified for increased tire clearance by Fast Cars Ltd. of Redondo Beach, California, in February 2021. The cockpit features low-backed bucket seats upholstered in black leather and fitted with latch-and-link belts. A plaque riveted to the dashboard lists the car’s chassis number, CSX1018, and a pair of six-volt Optima Red Top batteries are mounted behind the passenger seat. The seller tells us that the fixed driver’s seat has been positioned to accommodate drivers approximately 6’2″ and taller. A spare glovebox door with a Carroll Shelby signature is included in the sale. The wood-rimmed three-spoke steering wheel fronts Shelby American-branded AutoMeter instrumentation, which includes a 180-mph reverse-sweep speedometer and an 8k-rpm tachometer as well as gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, voltage, oil pressure, and fuel level. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 342 miles. The 427ci V8 features a four-barrel carburetor, an aluminum turkey pan, and finned Shelby-branded valve covers. An aluminum radiator and overflow tank are also fitted along with twin cooling fans.  Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transmission. A FuelSafe fuel cell was installed in 2024, and a clutch adjustment was performed in April 2025. The California BAR sticker shown above indicates SB-100 status and describes the vehicle as a 2011 Specially Constructed Cobra Replica with a 2010 Ford 7.0-liter engine. The BAR sticker lists the VIN CA972044, as shown on the California assigned identification number label. The car is titled in California as a “0000 SPCNS” using the VIN CSX1018, which corresponds with the Shelby Automobiles chassis tag pictured in the gallery below. html:
This Shelby is one of approximately 25 Cobra CSX1000 continuation cars completed with hand-formed aluminum bodywork out of England. This chassis features number CSX1018, which was purchased new by the current owner in February 2011 from Shelby Automobiles, Inc. The car is finished in white with blue over-the-top stripes over black leather upholstery, and power comes from a 427ci V8 paired with a four-speed manual transmission. Equipment includes disc brakes, 15″ Halibrand-style knock-off wheels, side-mounted exhaust pipes, quick-jack bumperettes, a single roll hoop, a hood scoop, a wood-rimmed steering wheel, and latch-and-link lap belts. A FuelSafe fuel cell was installed in 2024, and a clutch adjustment was performed in April 2025. This CSX1000 Cobra has 342 miles and is now offered by the seller on behalf of the owner with a Manufacturer’s Statement of Origin, a spare glovebox door with a Carroll Shelby signature, service records, and a clean California title in the name of the seller’s trust, listing the car as a special construction vehicle with no model year.

The CSX1000 series was introduced in the mid-2000s after Carroll Shelby reached an agreement with AC Cars to collaborate on a production run of aluminum-bodied continuation Cobras. After that partnership dissolved, the production of bodies for CSX1000 cars was shifted elsewhere in the UK.

This example is finished in white with blue over-the-top stripes and features quick-jack bumperettes, a hood scoop, vented front fenders, plexiglass wind wings, coated side-exit exhaust pipes, a single roll hoop, and a flip-up fuel filler cap.

Halibrand-style 15″ wheels with gray centers and polished lips are secured with three-eared knock-off spinners and are mounted with Goodyear Eagle Sport Car Special tires that measure 26.5×8″ up front and 26.5×10.5″ out back. The car is equipped with independent suspension, and stopping power is provided by discs at all four corners. The rear inner wheel wells were modified for increased tire clearance by Fast Cars Ltd. of Redondo Beach, California, in February 2021.

The cockpit features low-backed bucket seats upholstered in black leather and fitted with latch-and-link belts. A plaque riveted to the dashboard lists the car’s chassis number, CSX1018, and a pair of six-volt Optima Red Top batteries are mounted behind the passenger seat. The seller tells us that the fixed driver’s seat has been positioned to accommodate drivers approximately 6’2″ and taller. A spare glovebox door with a Carroll Shelby signature is included in the sale.

The wood-rimmed three-spoke steering wheel fronts Shelby American-branded AutoMeter instrumentation, which includes a 180-mph reverse-sweep speedometer and an 8k-rpm tachometer as well as gauges for oil temperature, coolant temperature, voltage, oil pressure, and fuel level. The five-digit mechanical odometer shows 342 miles.

The 427ci V8 features a four-barrel carburetor, an aluminum turkey pan, and finned Shelby-branded valve covers. An aluminum radiator and overflow tank are also fitted along with twin cooling fans. 

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transmission. A FuelSafe fuel cell was installed in 2024, and a clutch adjustment was performed in April 2025.

The California BAR sticker shown above indicates SB-100 status and describes the vehicle as a 2011 Specially Constructed Cobra Replica with a 2010 Ford 7.0-liter engine. The BAR sticker lists the VIN CA972044, as shown on the California assigned identification number label. The car is titled in California as a “0000 SPCNS” using the VIN CSX1018, which corresponds with the Shelby Automobiles chassis tag pictured in the gallery below.
